meta_description: Located in a rustic log cabin on two acres of showcase garden, the Palmer Museum and Visitor Center is the place to go for all your Palmer information needs.
hours_text:
[Home](https://palmermuseum.org) At the Museum

# At the Museum

# At the Museum

Our exhibits feature the story of the Palmer area, all the way from Ahtna times to the gold rush and finally through the Matanuska Colony. In addition to Palmer’s history, we strive to promote our town’s thriving arts culture, featuring many exhibits from Palmer artists.

After you see the museum, take a walking tour to experience our town’s story, or relax in our beautiful showcase garden. Experience the diversity of Alaska’s gardening and agriculture, including legendary giant vegetables, all in the heart of downtown. 

## Experience Our Showcase Garden

Wander and experience a dazzling variety of arctic flora in the Showcase Garden, adjacent to the museum.

[ More About the Garden ](https://palmermuseum.org/showcase-garden/)

## Take a Tour

Take a tour of Palmer’s historic downtown district! Explore the story of the 1935 Matanuska Colony firsthand, surrounded by the beautiful backdrop of the Chugach Mountains.

[ More About Tours ](https://palmer-museum.org/tours/)

## Explore our Exhibits

Explore the fascinating history and art of the Greater Palmer Area, or take a look of what is temporarily on display from the community.

[ Current & Upcoming Exhibits ](https://palmer-museum.org/exhibits/)

collections_text:
# Welcome to the Palmer Museum of History and Art

**Our work inspires, enriches, and cultivates our community’s connection to the unique history, culture, and art of the Greater Palmer Area.**

[ Plan Your Visit ](https://palmermuseum.org/at-the-museum/)

[ Become a Member ](https://app.joinit.com/o/palmer-museum-of-history-and-art/)

[ __ Winter Wine Walk Tickets ](https://palmermuseum.org/winter-wine-walk/)

## Welcome

The Palmer Museum and Visitor Center is your stop for all things history, art and culture in beautiful downtown Palmer! We are committed to telling Palmer’s story through historic art, local exhibits, and immersive tours. 

## Find Us

  * [ __ 723 S. Valley Way Palmer, Alaska 99645 ](https://www.google.com/maps/place/723+S+Valley+Way,+Palmer,+AK+99645/@61.5984979,-149.1152612,17z/data=!3m1!4b1!4m5!3m4!1s0x56c91df03dffbc17:0x81377cf1f5e9b13b!8m2!3d61.5984954!4d-149.1130724)
  * __ museuminfo@palmermuseum.org
  * __ (907) 746-7668

## Directions

_The town of Palmer (Ahtna name,_ Nuutah; Dena’ina name, _Dnal’iy Kena_ _) sits on the traditional lands of the Ahtna and Dena’ina Athabascan / Dene people. We are grateful to the Dene, past and present, for their care of this land. Thank you for helping us share the story of this place._

## Our Community. Your Community.

### Explore Palmer
